14.heading: King, Frank O., 1883-1969.
14.title: The Streator Scrapbooks : collected daily newspaper cartoons and strips.
14.author: [No author]
notes: 188 scrapbooks in 30 boxes 34 cm. x 47 cm. x 9 cm.

Scrapbooks of varying sizes assembled by a collector in Streator, Illinois, and numbered for reference after receipt at Michigan State University. Contents include generous selections, not sequentially arranged, of the works of Gene Ahern, George Clark, Bill Freyse, Frank King, Edgar Martin, Gaar Williams, Gluyas Williams, J.R. Williams, and others.

45.author: John W
45.appears_in: Dodds. chapter 8 (p. 213-235) in his Everyday Life in Twentieth Century America (New York : Putnam, 1965).
notes: Summary: Discussion of humor magazines, comedians, satire and comics, with sample illustrations by Clare Briggs (When a Feller Needs a Friend), John Held Jr., Charles Schulz (Peanuts), R.F. Outcault (The Yellow Kid, Buster Brown), F. Opper (Happy Hooligan), R. Dirks (The Katzenjammer Kids), George McManus (Bringing Up Father), Bud Fisher (Mutt and Jeff), Frank King (Gasoline Alley), and mention of others.

148.heading: King, Tappan W.
148.title: "The Image in Motion"
148.author: by Tappan W
148.appears_in: King. p. 11-18 in Crimmer's: The Harvard Journal of Pictorial Fiction (Winter 1975)
notes: SUMMARY: "The author traces the 20th century's fascination with movement, starting from Muybridge's photographic dissection of a man running and evolving through various artistic schools and media, cubism in painting, Hogarth in narrative art, Griffith in film. Comics especially are examined for their evolution from the key figure of Winsor McCay."

153.heading: King, Tracy.
153.title: Espers : Black Magic
153.author: by James D
notes: "Tracy King is possessed by the evil spirit of Aldo Roth. Roth was a powerful necromancer who wanted to usher the world into an age of darkness. Now he's back to finish the job he started in 1775. Roth leads a band of occult assassins out to kill the Espers. Brian Marx has other ideas. Brian was Tracy's boyfriend. He's also a Random Mage. Brian can turn ordinary objects into magical weapons. When Brian teams up with the Espers to stop Roth, things literally go to hell."
